result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond Joseph Sims

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raymond Joseph Sims appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda J. Olsen appeared in Court for Raymond Joseph Sims.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.
Defense counsel recently appointed and requests more time.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Raymond Joseph Sims appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. 
Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel. Court appoints attorney Amanda Olsen to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning 06-01-2023, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case adjourned for status conference, Branch 2 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Raymond Joseph Sims in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant appears without counsel. Defendant requests more time to retain counse. Case adjourned to Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-21-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TM, RDM. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Raymond Joseph Sims in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymond Joseph Sims not in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
He called the court and informed us that he tested positive for COVID.
Defendant failing to appear, court ordered arrest warrant issued but STAYED issuance until 7/19/2022, at 2:00 p.m. If he fails to appear a WARRANT will be issued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-1-2022 @2p
